Topic.Title: Bush was a better President!

Message.Msg: meanwhile in the real world were sane people function In an informal survey of 109 professional historians conducted over a three-week period through the History News Network, 98.2 percent assessed the presidency of Mr. Bush to be a failure while 1.8 percent classified it as a success. Asked to rank the presidency of George W. Bush in comparison to those of the other 41 American presidents, more than 61 percent of the historians concluded that the current presidency is the worst in the nation’s history. Another 35 percent of the historians surveyed rated the Bush presidency in the 31st to 41st category, while only four of the 109 respondents ranked the current presidency as even among the top two-thirds of American administrations.

Topic.Title: BREAKING..SUSPECT #2 WAS NOT MIRANDIZED

Message.Msg: let me teach you a little bit about the Constitution you teapigs are always talking about--- Failing to give a Miranda warning only excludes testimonial evidence given by the suspect . All other evidence e.g. eyewitness, forensic, etc is not tainted and is therefore admissible-- you ignantphk.

Message.Title: Constitutional law 101 for teapigs
Message.Msg: The failure or choice not to Mirandize a suspect does not mean he goes free. It only prevents oral testimony from the suspect ( or "fruit from the poisoned tree) from being admitted at trial. All other testimony such as eyewitness and forensic,-- (fingerprints etc.) are still admissible. They don't need his confession to get a conviction. You tepaigs sicken me. You are always quick to invoke the Constitution and you know nothing about it.
